Python Project Management

For how easy everything else is in Python , project and dependency management is painfully awkward. I usually stick to Pyenv and pip-tools, which are familiar to me.

note

This section is ordered by familiarity, not by any evaluation of relative qualities! And no. This isn’t all of the Python package and project management tools out there.

pip

The package installer for Python

Related

pip · PyPI

pip documentation

venv

Use it to create lightweight isolated Python environments for projects.

venv — Creation of virtual environments

Use a Python venv in Nushell #process #Nushell

 
overlay use .venv/Scripts/activate.nu

Pyenv

For managing your Python installations. I use pyenv and pyenv-virtualenv.

Pyenv Dependencies

Pyenv wiki: Suggested build environment

Ubuntu:

sudo apt install build-essential libssl-dev zlib1g-dev \
  libbz2-dev libreadline-dev libsqlite3-dev curl \
  libncursesw5-dev xz-utils tk-dev libxml2-dev \
  libxmlsec1-dev libffi-dev liblzma-dev

Setting up Pyenv dependencies on EndeavourOS

yay -S --needed base-devel openssl zlib xz tk

Related

GitHub - pyenv/pyenv: Simple Python version management

pip-tools

Keeps project dependencies fresh, and that’s all it does.

Related

GitHub - jazzband/pip-tools: A set of tools to keep your pinned Python dependencies fresh.

Poetry

Dependency and package management for Python projects

Installing Poetry

 
curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -

Related

Poetry - Python dependency management and packaging made easy

PDM

Package and dependency manager for Python

PDM’s main novelty on release was support for PEP 582 — Python local packages directory, project-local dependency management similar to Node.js or maybe Bundler. After the Python Steering Council rejected 582, there’s less to distinguish PDM from other project management tools. They still focus on PEP support, so they’re at least trying to adhere to whatever standards Python decides on. I like that.

PEP 517 – A build-system independent format for source trees

PEP 517 – A build-system independent format for source trees

Commands
Command Description
add Add package(s) to pyproject.toml and install them
build Build artifacts for distribution
cache Control the caches of PDM
completion Generate completion scripts for the given shell
config Display the current configuration
export Export the locked packages set to other formats
fix Fix the project problems according to the latest version of PDM
import Import project metadata from other formats
info Show the project information
init Initialize a pyproject.toml for PDM
install Install dependencies from lock file
list List packages installed in the current working set
lock Resolve and lock dependencies
publish Build and publish the project to PyPI
remove Remove packages from pyproject.toml
run Run commands or scripts with local packages loaded
search Search for PyPI packages
self Manage the PDM program itself (previously known as plugin)
show Show the package information
sync Synchronize the current working set with lock file
update Update package(s) in pyproject.toml
use Use the given python version or path as base interpreter
venv Virtualenv management

Related

PDM

Pipenv

Python virtual environment and dependency management

Related

Pipenv: Python Dev Workflow for Humans

Astral: Ruff and uv

Ruff (linter) and uv (dependency installer) for Python

Ruff

Fast linter and formatter for Python

Jots

Install it to your project venv

uv pip install ruff

Check your project files

ruff check

Format your project files

ruff format

Related

GitHub - astral-sh/ruff: An extremely fast Python linter and code formatter, written in Rust.

Ruff - Visual Studio Marketplace

GitHub - astral-sh/ruff-lsp: A Language Server Protocol implementation for Ruff.

uv

Drop-in replacement for pip and pip-tools workflows

Jots

uv represents an intermediary goal in our pursuit of a “Cargo for Python”: a comprehensive project and package manager that is extremely fast, reliable, and easy to use.

Installing uv

Installing on macOS with Homebrew:

brew install uv

Installing uv on EndeavourOS :

yay -S uv

Installing uv on Windows:

powershell -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex"

Using uv

Usage assumes you’re working in a virtualenv

For working with a pip-tools style requirements.in file:

uv pip compile requirements.in -o requirements.txt
uv pip sync requirements.txt

Related

GitHub - astral-sh/uv: An extremely fast Python package installer and resolver, written in Rust.

Related

Astral: Next-gen Python tooling

pipx

For running Python applications more than building them.

GitHub - pypa/pipx: Install and Run Python Applications in Isolated Environments
